description:
This is the head of the Lion Nebula (Sharpless 132) in Cepheus, also known as LDN 1161.  I've imaged the Lion Nebula before, but not a close up of just the head, which has a lot of really interesting detail, particularly in Ha. 

I continue to try out new processing techniques to try and find new / different / more striking color palettes.  For this, I tried a couple of different Pixelmath combinations with synthetic green channels, and both had their merits: one had some very lovely blues, and the other had the gold I was shooting for near the center.  Rather than pick one versus the other, I used Pixelmath's version of screen blending (~(~IMG1*~IMG2)) to see if I could get the best of both worlds, and while it wasn't perfect, it definitely was an improvement over either image alone. 

I continued to use Adam Block's star emphasis technique, which I'm finding is becoming a regular part of my workflow.  What I need to pay close attention to are the large stars, that they don't get touched by the process.   

I'm still not 100% happy with this: it's not quite as clean as I would like, and as noise-free as the Ha and Oiii masters suggest.  Somewhere through all the editing it's gotten a little overcooked, when you zoom in to the pixel level, and I need to be mindful of that in either subsequent revisions and/or in future images.  It's odd because normally you find that in over-sharpened images, but this has had little to no sharpening applied beyond initial deconvolution, which was subtle.  Anyway!  I AM happy with the color palette, and the past few images have really helped me get that where I want it.  I'll work on not creating noise / artifacts in subsequent images.
title: The Lion's Head - LDN 1161
